thread.title: Local Rundown: Bradshaw Mountain upsets Sedona Scorpions in volleyball
thread.title_full: Local Rundown: Bradshaw Mountain upsets Sedona Scorpions in volleyball

title: Local Rundown: Bradshaw Mountain upsets Sedona Scorpions in volleyball
text: Brian M. Bergner Jr. The Daily Courier PRESCOTT VALLEY - Senior Joelle Bobinsky recorded the volleyball triple-double for the Bears with 12 kills, 16 assists and 16 digs to lead the Bradshaw Mountain volleyball team to a 3-2 upset victory over No. 25-ranked Sedona Red Rock on Thursday.The Bears lost the first two games, 25-14, 25-21, but rebounded out of a 2-0 hole to win three straight, 25-17, 25-21, 15-9, and claim the upset and surprise the Scorpions, which won a state championship just three years ago."I was so proud of them," Bradshaw Mountain head coach Natali Washburn said after the win.Standout performances for Bradshaw Mountain [14-10 Overall] included junior Randee Clifford, who finished her night with 15 assists and 12 digs while teammate junior Katherine Brannan had nine kills, eight digs and a .172 attack percentage. Te'ya Baker chipped in with 18 digs.Other standouts include senior Emma Williams had seven kills, six digs and one solo block while senior Kyre McNeil had four kills and one solo block.Next up, the No. 37-ranked Bears will travel to North Canyon on Tuesday, Oct. 13. Official start time is set for 6 p.m. Gomez nets career-high five goals, Chino Valley drops rival Cowboys 6-1 CAMP VERDE - Forward Arturo Gomez scored a career-high five goals to continue his masterful junior campaign and the Chino Valley boys soccer team won its seventh straight contest with a 6-1 win over rival Camp Verde on Thursday night.Gomez now has 31 goals this season, and he's big reason why the Cougars are No. 1 in the AIA Power Point Poll for Division V."Camp Verde always plays us tough and they came out and played excellent," longtime Chino Valley head coach Jim Clark said about the Cowboys, which came out and netted a goal to take a 1-0 lead just 10 minutes in. "They were high energy for 15 minutes, but then we began to pick away and took care of business."Chino Valley [15-1 Overall] would score six unanswered goals after that. Walter Soto had two assists while Elijah Desmond, Kendall Foster and Jordan Sanchez each had one assist.The Cougars have three matches left in the regular season, the first coming Saturday, Oct. 10, at Northland Preparatory in Flagstaff. Official start time is noon. Bears golf takes home another win KINGMAN - On a windy afternoon at the Valle Vista Country Club, the Bradshaw Mountain golf team stayed the course and shot a 183 [+39] to take first overall on Thursday afternoon.Junior Anne Transier turned in the top card for the Bears with a 5-over-par 41 while senior Hunter Rowe shot a 7-over-par 43."It was a windy day. All the teams shot poorly," Bradshaw Mountain head coach David Capka said, adding that almost everything to the right on the back nine was out-of-bounds. "We were able to play through it."Junior Jacob Kidd finished his nine holes with a 49 [+13] while senior Tanner Spohn was fourth overall for the Bears with a 14-over-par 50.Lee Williams took second in the four-way tournament with a 184 [+40]; Mingus was third overall with a 191 [+47] and Kingman rounded out the field with a 226 [+82].Next up, the Bears will travel south to play Ironwood at the Lakes West Golf Course on Tuesday, Sept. 13. Tee time is scheduled for 3 p.m. Foster scores two goals, propels Cougars to 3-2 win over Camp Verde CHINO VALLEY -Lauren Foster scored two goals, Katie Farnsworth added another and the Chino Valley girls soccer team continued to roll in a 3-2 win over rival Camp Verde on Thursday afternoon.Foster, a freshman forward, scored her first goal in the 32nd minute off an assist by junior goalkeeper Giselle Chinchilla, who punted the ball from her own box and watched it sail over Cowboy defenders. Foster caught up with it just in time to beat Camp Verde's goalkeeper for the score.And since Farnsworth had already made it a 1-0 affair after her goal in the 15th minute, the lucky bounce put Chino Valley up 2-0."It was some kick," Chino Valley head coach Allen Foster said about his goalkeeper's strong boot that led to odd goal.Foster would score her second goal of the night in the 62nd minute to put Chino Valley [12-4 Overall] up 3-1 after she took it right from Camp Verde's goalkeeper, who was attempting to kick it out of the box.It is the second straight win for the Cougars, and their 11th out of the last 12 matches, but despite that, Chino Valley hasn't budged from their No. 7 ranking in the AIA Power Point Poll for Division V."The downfall is we're not moving up in the rankings, but with Blue Ridge next week, that may change," Foster said. The Cougars are scheduled to travel to Blue Ridge, ranked No. 1 in the state, on Thursday, Oct. 15. Official start time is 3 p.m. Prescott badminton beats Pinnacle 8-1 PRESCOTT - After recording their first shutout of the season in power point matches against Barry Goldwater just 24 hours earlier, the Prescott badminton team followed with an 8-1 victory over visiting Pinnacle on Wednesday night.In varsity singles, No. 1 Lauren Mazzella defeated London McCormick, 8-11, 11-2, 11-6, while teammate Andie Gonzales won against Karlee Johnson, 11-5, 11-9.No. 3 Morgan Feingold defeated Kaitlyn Cazier, 10-13, 11-3, 11-6; No. 4 Sara Kosse won over Courtney Lewerke, 11-3, 11-4; Sydney Gonzales defeated Karrie Barnes, 11-3, 11-5; and No. 6 player Abby Nelson beat Kiara Johansen, 11-0, 11-2.In doubles, Gonzales and Feingold lost to Pinnacle's No. 1 and 2, 15-11, 17-15, while Mazzella and Kosse won, 11-15, 17-16, 15-11. No. 3 duo Sydney Gonzales and Nelson won, 15-3, 15-1.The Badgers are now 6-1 in power point matches this season and are No. 7 in the AIA polls. Next up, Prescott will travel south to play Deer Valley on Tuesday, Oct. 13. Official start time is set for 4 p.m. Follow Brian M. Bergner Jr. on Twitter at @SportsWriter52 or reach him by phone at 928-445-3333, ext. 1106, or 928-899-6946.
